casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff—Appellee, v. Freddy S. CAMPBELL, Defendant-Appellant. No. 08-7085. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: Nov. 13, 2008. Decided: Nov. 19, 2008. Freddy S. Campbell, Appellant Pro Se. John J. Frail, Assistant United States Attorney, Charleston, West Virginia, for Appellee.

Before WILKINSON, NIEMEYER, and SHEDD, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

PER CURIAM:

Freddy Campbell appeals the district court’s order denying his 18 U.S.C. § 3582(c) (2006) motion. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. United States v. Campbell, No. 2:05-cr-00120-l (S.D. W. Va. June 5, 2008). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
